findings.title: Hardcoded gas prices in python scripts
findings.description: The gas prices to be used for transactions are hard-coded in the python scripts meant for smart-contract interactions, which can lead to failed or delayed transactions during times of high transaction fees or to excessive cost when gas prices are low.

findings.title: Compiler Version
findings.description: The code uses `pragma solidity ^0.6.0;` to define the compiler version to be used, but it is recommended to lock the pragma to use the latest 0.6 Solidity release: `pragma solidity 0.6.12;`.
